text: Bozcaada is an island in Aegean Sea. It is the third largest island of Turkey. Bozcaada is also a district of Ã‡anakkale Province. Bozcaada has 2,500 inhabitants. The main economical activities are tourism and fishing. The island is well known for its grapes and wines. Romanlar live there and works as Coachmen. Category:Islands of Turkey
title: Bozcaada
